strings: <Cap><leader> discovers a new recipe for the alchemy pot!
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3>
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3> + <Cap><string_4>
<se_def>*: Hmm!? You not from this island, are you?

<se_def>*: You see? We surround by steep cliffs.
I am shock to see outsiders here!

<se_def>*: Gojoshar! Welcome to Empycchu.
In our native tongue, ‘Empycchu’ means
‘those who venerate the Godbird Empyrea’.

<se_def>*: Gojoshar! Welcome to Empycchu.
In our native tongue, ‘Empycchu’ means
‘those who venerate the Godbird Empyrea’.

<se_high>*: You saw shadow of large bird?
It's Empyrea. The Godbird.

<se_high>*: Empyrea is very mysterious bird.
She only show us her shadow.
<se_high>*: It was so rare to see her shadow, so rare for us. But recently, we see her shadow more and more often.
<se_low>*: (Whinny!)
<se_low>*: (Snort!)

<se_low>*: That large, gate-shaped rock over there?
It's for Empyrea. It's roost for her,
if she ever come to Empycchu again.
<se_low>*: If you leave village and walk left, there is grass field. Large rock with same shape is there.
<se_low>*: Empycchu people say it is original roost of the Godbird. People often see Empyrea's shadow near it. That is why we think of it as her roost.

<se_high>*: The monsters become aggressive recently.
They attack, and knock down those pillars.

<se_high>*: Empyrea appear very often these days.
It make monsters very nervous.
This is not a good thing!

<se_high>*: If you wish to learn about Empyrea,
please talk to the Chief. He loves telling stories.

<se_high>*: You see? The large hut over there.
That is the Chief's.

<se_low>*: I have been told. Our Godbird Empyrea,
her body is in the other world.
<se_low>*: It is why we can only see her shadow in this world. But I have also been told, her true form is very beautiful.

<se_low>*: It is what the Chief told me once.
I always wonder, is it true?
<se_def>*: The monsters, they are very aggressive lately. This is why I care for my bow. So I can use it, in a time of need.
<se_low>*: Gojoshar! Wait! Are you...customers? Actual customers!? The people of this village don't buy and sell goods, so this is a rare pleasure!

<se_low>*: It has been so long since I have seen anyone from outside Empycchu! Come! Have a look!
I have many items for you to see!
<se_low>*: I am blacksmith. But I can make only pots, pans, and small knives.

<se_low>*: The weapons you carry very beautiful.
I can not make such beautiful thing.
<se_low>*: You may be sad if you look for new armours and weapons here in this village.

<se_high>*: Did you see man in the Chief's hut?
He wearing very uncomfortable clothes?
He is outsider, like you.
He is kind but also very, very strange.

<se_high>*: The things he say, they are so strange.
The Goddess doing this, the Goddess doing that, always! He even build a strange altar inside his room!

<se_high>*: Is that how your people speak?
It is the very strange to me...

<se_high>*: This hut is only for children.
Are you surprise? So are the others too,
who come from outside the island!
<se_high>*: We prepare foods, cleanings, and take care of the littlest ones. Together!

<se_high>*: We all go home at the night, though.
Many monsters outside now. It is dangerous.
<se_high>*: Did your ship sink by a storm, too?
<se_high>*: Spiffing! Most people who came to this island came because their ships sinked!
<se_high>*: No? How did you come here, then?

<se_high>*: Did you fly or something? Ha, ha, ha!
Only the Godbird Empyrea can fly!
<se_high>*: Hm? She fell asleep!
<se_high>*: Oh, now she even drool! Napping now very bad. She will not be able to sleep tonight...
<se_high>*: Ah-phew, ah-phew...

<se_def>*: Because of Empyrea, all the monsters very angry! It is very hard to hunt for food now.
I am angry too! At the Godbird!

<se_def>*: I know she is our holy Godbird.
But I cannot eat my tongue.

<se_def>*: I would tell her myself. But she shows nothing to us. Nothing but her shadow!
Grrr! I am even more angry!

<se_low>*: By the Goddess! Visitors!? Spiffing!
I am the priest of this little settlement!<page>*: I found my way here when my ship was wrecked on the shoals off this island,
many years ago.
<se_low>*: Of course, it was all the will of the Goddess. Ever since then, I have devoted my life to teaching the natives here about Her truth.<page>*: I must admit, it hasn't always been easy...
<se_low>*: No, I shall not bemoan this great responsibility which the Goddess has bestowed upon me! She has entrusted Her wayward sheep to my care. <page>*: It is a sacred mission. Pardon me.

<se_high>*: Gojoshar! You are not from here.
Your clothes, they give you away.
<se_high>*: You must be very tired from your long journey! Please, why don't you stay a night here? It's okay. I won't expect anything in return!
<se_high>*: Make <IF_SOLO>yourself<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>yourselves<ENDIF_SOLO> at home!
<se_high>*: Gojoshar <endash> or is it ‘good morning’, as you say outside the island? When you need a rest, you come any time. You are always welcome here!

<se_high>*: No? I see. But there is no need to be shy!
Just remember: whenever you need a rest,
you come here any time.
<se_high>*: Gojoshar <endash> or is it ‘good morning’, as you say outside the island? When you need a rest, you come any time. You are always welcome here!

<se_high>*: Hm? Are you change your mind?
Want to stay here?
<se_low>Chief: (Mumble, mumble.)

<se_low>Chief: Hm!? Who are you? Gojoshar, gojoshar.
You do not seem to be of this village...?
<se_low>Chief: ...I see. So you want to learn about the Godbird Empyrea? I praise your inquisitive attitude.

<se_low>Chief: According to legend, Empyrea once could travel freely between two worlds.<page>Chief: The first world is called the World of Light, and it is the world we inhabit. The other is called the World of Darkness.
<se_low>Chief: This ability to travel freely was a very special one. It was only granted to Empyrea.

<se_low>Chief: One day, the evil ruler of the World of Darkness built a huge gate between the two worlds.<page>Chief: He was unsatisfied, you see. He wanted to conquer not just the World of Darkness but the World of Light as well.
<se_low>Chief: To prevent a catastrophe, Empyrea flew to the World of Darkness and used all her power to close the gate herself.

<se_low>Chief: It is said in the legends that her efforts worked. The gate was successfully closed.<page>Chief: Unfortunately, she had no energy left to return to the World of Light. All that remains to this day is her shadow.
<se_low>Chief: It is also said that her shadow occasionally creates a doorway, an entrance to the World of Darkness, called the Dark Eye.
<se_low>Chief: To be honest, I do not exactly know what it is. But it is said that if you walk through the Dark Eye, your next step will be into the World of Darkness.
<se_low>Chief: So I strongly advise you not to casually follow the shadow of Empyrea, for you may fall into the Dark Eye without even noticing it.
<se_low>Chief: To prevent a catastrophe, Empyrea flew to the World of Darkness and used all her power to close the gate herself.
<se_low>Chief: The gate was successfully closed.<page>Chief: Unfortunately, she had no energy left to return to the World of Light. All that remains to this day is her shadow.

<se_low>Chief: However, her special ability still remains.
The shadow occasionally creates a doorway,
an entrance to the World of Darkness,
called the Dark Eye.
<se_low>Chief: So I strongly advise you not to casually follow the shadow of Empyrea, for you may fall into the Dark Eye without even noticing it.
<se_high>*: Why is everyone think so sure that Empyrea is beautiful? We only see her shadow! Is a big bird, though, that is for sure!
<se_def>*: I heard that you can disappear, if you follow Godbird Empyrea. Is this really true...?
<se_def>*: Sometimes, I think the Chief making this all up to frighten us!
<se_high>*: Oooh, everyone too loud! Can't sleep!
<se_high>*: Do you know? There is very tall mountain, southwest of village.

<se_high>*: That mountain is called the Godbird's Eyrie.
The Chief said ‘Eyrie’ means ‘nest’.
But why it is called such a name,
I do not know.
<se_high>*: None without wings may go and see. It is too high to climb on foot, you know what I mean?

<se_high>*: Besides, Empyrea is just shadow anyway.
Does shadow need a nest? I wonder...

<se_high>*: Oh, dear!
I fell asleep while telling a story to my child!
<se_high>*: (Yawn!) Well, I think it's all right to go back and sleep now.
<se_high>*: Good night... Zzzzzz...!
<se_high>*: Zzzzz...cooking, cleaning... Zzzzzzz!

<se_high>*: How you find our secret place!?
Nobody comes the place like this at night!
But you did! And caught us!
<se_high>*: Will you keep this a secret, about us? Please?
<se_def>*: Aaaaa! Who are you!? What are you doing here, at the middle of night!? You scare me!

<se_def>*: What? What are WE doing here?
Ah, er... You know! Discussing, discussing...
About how to raise horses! Yes!
<se_def>*: It is not suspicious! I promise! I mean it!

<se_high>*: I want to staying up. Until my little
sister falling asleep. But I am so tiring!
I do not thinking I can...!
<se_high>*: Zzzzz!

<se_high>*: He promised to stay up, but he not!
He lied to me! (Sob!)
<se_high>*: Zzzzz...zzz...
<se_high>*: I no can sleep! Because I took nap...

<se_def>*: Gojoshar! Welcome to Empycchu.
In our native tongue, ‘Empycchu’ means
‘those who venerate the Godbird Empyrea’.
<se_high>*: I haven't seen Empyrea's shadow lately.

<se_high>*: How about you?
Have you seen it?

<se_high>*: W-WHAT!?
You say you actually saw the Godbird herself!?

<se_high>*: Ha, ha, ha! That is spiffing good one!
You outsiders are always saying funny things!

<se_def>*: Your white horse is most beautifullest,
but my horses are beautiful as well.
They are purely-breds horses, of Empycchu!
<se_def>*: I decided to offer my two horses as dowry. For my woman I want to marry.
<se_high>*: Why are the men in our village all such lazy?
<se_high>*: How long are the pillars going to be left like this!? It is so difficult to get in and out of the village now!

<se_high>*: Now you done it! You got the Chief started.
Ever since you asked about Empyrea,
he is telling his old stories to everyone!

<se_high>*: I have heard the same ones so many times,
I am wanting to pull my hair out!
<se_high>*: Really!? You really can fly into the sky!?
<se_high>*: Spiffing! The outsiders can do many things that we cannot!
<se_high>*: Can I fly too? If I try very hard?

<se_high>*: ...I know. Humans no can fly.
We no have wings! Right?
<se_high>*: Really!? You can fly into the sky!?
<se_high>*: Really!? You can fly into the sky!?

<se_def>*: When Empyrea's shadow flew in the past,
she drove the monsters violent. We were so angry at her.

<se_def>*: But now, she suddenly stops showing herself.
I feel actually, I am missing her.
I wonder how she is doing...?

<se_low>Chief: Why, it is you again! Gojoshar, gojoshar!
You came here to hear my stories again?

<se_low>Chief: Yes, yes! I knew you would say that!
I shall tell you now about Rhapthorne,
the Lord of Darkness. Ahem.

<se_low>Chief: Rhapthorne, the foul ruler of the World of Darkness, had an evil ambition to bridge his realm and our World of Light.<page>Chief: He wanted nothing less than absolute control over all creation.

<se_low>Chief: However, only Empyrea was granted the privilege to cross between the two worlds.<page>Chief: Even as the Lord of Darkness, it was no easy task for Rhapthorne to contrive a connection between the two.

<se_low>Chief: So, Rhapthorne built a floating castle.
It had the power to create a portal,
a gate connecting the Worlds of Light
and Darkness.
<se_low>Chief: He channelled all of the floating castle's power to ready the gate.<page>Chief: Once it was open, he launched a ferocious attack against the World of Light.
<se_low>Chief: To make a long story short, Rhapthorne's ambitions came to naught in the end.<page>Chief: Empyrea closed the gate, and the great sages contrived a way to imprison Rhapthorne forever.
<se_low>Chief: The legends tell us no more of what happened to the great floating castle.<page>Chief: Perhaps it was destroyed. Perhaps it lies somewhere deep beneath the ground.
<se_low>Chief: No? Oh, that is a shame. Those words are like poison to an old man's heart!
<se_low>Chief: I have so many stories to tell you in the little time we share together...
<se_low>Chief: Attempting to become an almighty god of all creation, Rhapthorne waged a war against the World of Light from his floating castle.
<se_low>Chief: But his foul ambitions were doomed by the great sages and the Godbird Empyrea.
<se_low>Chief: The legends tell us no more of what happened to the great floating castle.<page>Chief: Perhaps it was destroyed. Perhaps it lies somewhere deep beneath the ground.
<se_def>*: Enough is enough! I have heard too much about Empyrea already!
<se_def>*: Please, can you pick another thing for discuss!? It is very late. I am trying to relax!

<se_high>*: Have you heard?<page>*: There are many stories of the Godbird's Eyrie.
It lies to the southwest of this village.
Many believe that there is treasure hidden there.

<se_high>*: But nobody knows the truth.
To get there, one would need wings!
You know what I mean?

<se_high>*: If the rumour is true, who hid the treasure?
I feel curiousness!

<se_def>*: I wish I could give a horse like yours!
Then would my bride know how big my love is!
<se_def>*: Hey, <IF_SOLO>outsider<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>outsiders<ENDIF_SOLO>! Tell me! What is exactly going on outside of the island? You must know?

<se_def>*: The Chief told us! The red sky, it is
the sign...of the Lord of the Darkness!
I think he is loco. Right?
<se_def>*: He is wrong, right? Wrong! Right?

<se_def>*: I knew he was wrong! I am much relieved
to know this. The Chief, he is very much a
big talker!

<se_def>*: No! It cannot be! You must be joking!
So what we are going to do!?<page>*: We don't have great sages! And Empyrea disappear! And the world is end! Aaaaaieee!
<se_high>*: I think the Godbird Empyrea was trying to warn us. By showing her shadow to us.
<se_high>*: But now, she disappeared...
<se_high>*: Was she disappointed in us? Because we didn't understand what she was really doing?
<se_def>*: Why now? Why Rhapthorne pick now to come back? Why? I am about to marry my woman!

<se_def>*: Our love life is about to begin! How you
say on the outside, the honey love moon!
I don't want to die before my honey love moon!
<se_low>*: Neigh!
<se_low>*: Neigh!

<se_low>*: I was walking just like this the other day.
And I saw a big flying shadow.

<se_low>*: Is it castle of the Lord of Darkness?
The one the Chief told us about?

<se_high>*: Finally were the pillars fixed the other day.
But earthquake made them fall again.
<se_high>*: That earthquake... It did not feel natural to me. And the sky! The sky turn red, right after the earthquake!

<se_high>*: The Chief's stories are harmless.
So long as they only annoying people.

<se_high>*: But now his stories begin worrying,
they begin causing a stir. I wish the Chief were more thinking. He needs to lead the people of the village.
<se_def>*: I feel frustrate! Stuck in the island, when the whole world is in trouble!

<se_def>*: I only guessing what is going on outside!
It is not easy, to be like this.

<se_low>*: I want to think that Empyrea will protect us.
I want to believe that we would be fine,
even if the Lord of Darkness attacks us...

<se_low>*: But she is just a shadow.
How can a shadow to help us?
<se_low>*: When the time comes, the warriors of Empycchu must fight. We have no choice.
<se_def>*: I saw! I saw! A large stone, no, a rock, no, a mountain... No! It! It was flying in the north!

<se_def>*: Was it the castle of the Lord of Darkness?
Just like the Chief said?
But how can we attack it!?

<se_def>*: Even the best bow-man cannot shoot an
arrow that far! If I could fly like a bird...
Then I could fight!
<se_high>*: Ever since the red sky, my mum says to stay inside always. She says I am too dangerous!

<se_high>*: I want to go out...
I want to play with my friends!
<se_low>*: Oh, it's you again! Thanks to the latest, er, abnormal phenomenon, business is getting worse and worse. I'm glad to see your <IF_SOLO>face<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>faces<ENDIF_SOLO>!

<se_low>*: Come!
Have a look! I have many items for you to see!
<se_high>*: I'm happy to see you. Having <IF_SOLO>a visitor<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>visitors<ENDIF_SOLO> like you in this village means that the outside world is still safe.

<se_high>*: Every day I wake up here, I wonder.
What if the Lord of Darkness already
destroyed everything but Empycchu?
<se_high>*: Nobody play. Everyone's parents stay them in!
<se_high>*: It is just the sky! Why adults worry so much?

<se_high>*: The Chief always tells me the same story!
I boring with it!
<se_high>*: I want to play! But the Chief makes us sit and listen to his stories!

<se_high>*: Will you listen instead?
Then we can go play!
<se_low>*: The people of this village are quite lovely, really. But their Achilles' heel is that they're deeply superstitious.
<se_low>*: Even if the sky did turn red, I trust in the almighty Goddess! She would never allow the Lord of Darkness to rise again!

<se_low>*: O benevolent Goddess, forgive me my sins!
If only I can work a little harder,
I can convince these poor wayward sheep
of your divine power...!

<se_high>*: Hm? <IF_SOLO>A visitor<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>Visitors<ENDIF_SOLO>! At the time like this!
How surprising! Gojoshar, gojoshar!
<se_high>*: You must be very tired from your long journey! Please, why don't you stay a night here? It's okay. I won't expect anything in return!
<se_high>*: Make <IF_SOLO>yourself<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>yourselves<ENDIF_SOLO> at home!
<se_high>*: Gojoshar <endash> or is it ‘good morning’, as you say outside the island? When you need rest, you come any time. You are always welcome here!

<se_high>*: No? I see. But there is no need to be shy!
Just remember: whenever you need a rest,
you come here any time.
<se_high>*: Gojoshar <endash> or is it ‘good morning’, as you say outside the island? When you need rest, you come any time. You are always welcome here!

<se_high>*: Hm? Are you change your mind?
Want to stay here?

<se_low>Chief: Why, it's you again! Gojoshar, gojoshar!
You came here because you wanted to hear the
old story behind the latest strange happenings!
Am I right?
<se_low>Chief: Of course, of course. Who doesn't love a story? Let us begin. Ahem.
<se_low>Chief: As you know, a red sky covered our world several days ago. In fact, this is not the first time. No, it happened once before.
<se_low>Chief: It happened when Rhapthorne, the Lord of Darkness, used his floating castle to attack this world long, long ago.

<se_low>Chief: If the old tales are any indication,
the red sky is the sign that the
Lord of Darkness has awakened.

<se_low>Chief: These days, though, we don't have the seven
great sages to save us. And even worse,
our Godbird Empyrea is but a shadow...<page>Chief: Yes, the World of Light is in crisis!

<se_low>Chief: No? That is too bad.
You are breaking an old man's heart!
<se_low>Chief: How can you call <IF_SOLO>yourself a true adventurer<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>yourselves true adventurers<ENDIF_SOLO> if you aren't interested in hearing of the dangers that face our world!?
<se_low>Chief: As you know, a red sky enveloped our world several days ago. In fact, this is not the first time. No, it happened once before.

<se_low>Chief: If the old tales are any indication,
the red sky is the sign that the
Lord of Darkness has awakened.

<se_low>Chief: These days, though, we don't have the seven
great sages to save us. And even worse,
our Godbird Empyrea is but a shadow...

<se_high>*: Empyrea hasn't show herself in these days.
I wonder where she went?
<se_high>*: I wish she show herself, especially now at the time like this! It would be a big support for us...
<se_def>*: As a warrior of Empycchu, I have trained my mind and body to fight whenever it is necessary.
<se_def>*: But the single glance at the castle of the Lord of Darkness... It was enough to make me question my confidence.
<se_high>*: Oooh, everyone too loud! Can't sleep!
<se_high>*: What made you to come here at such a time of crisis? Incredible!
<se_high>*: You are brave like my husband!
<se_high>*: Zzzzz! ...Want go play... Zzzzzz!
<se_high>*: Everybody says the red sky is meaning the Lord of Darkness is coming!

<se_high>*: But what does that meaning?
I'm so scared, my big stallion...

<se_def>*: Don't you worry, my baby foal.
There be nothing to be worry about.
I'm here.

<se_def>*: I will protect you! Even if I must die myself!
I promise you!
<se_high>*: Hey! Can you get a clue, please!?
<se_high>*: My big stallion and I are in the middle of...something! Just leave us alone!
<se_def>*: Aaaaa! Who are you!? What are you doing here, at the middle of night!? You scare me!

<se_def>*: What? What are WE doing here?
Ah, er... You know! Discussing, discussing...
How to defeating the Lord of Darkness! Yes!
<se_def>*: We didn't do anything, um, pleasurable here! Please to believe me!

<se_high>*: I want to staying up. Until my little
sister falling asleep. But I am so tiring!
I do not thinking I can...!
<se_high>*: Zzzzz... Zzzz...

<se_high>*: He promised to stay up, but he not!
He lied to me! (Sob!)
<se_high>*: Ah-phew, ah-phew...
<se_high>*: I no can sleep! I am staying home too long!
<se_high>*: Do you know anything about Alchemy?

<se_high>*: There is a place somewhere in this world,
where you can see a line of stones.
They are carve with a variety of recipes.
<se_high>*: I don't know who made them, but he must have plenty time to kill, that is for sure!
<se_low>*: I heard there is shield that can be only equipped by woman.

<se_low>*: I remember that shield is called
‘saintess shield’. It made by combining
two kinds of shields and a phial of
holy water, or something like that!
